meanings.definition: A person who determines the sex of animals.
meanings.sent1: The sexer at the farm can tell if a baby chick is a boy or a girl.
meanings.sent2: The sexer carefully examines each animal to identify its gender.
meanings.sent3: The sexer joked that they could guess the gender of the animals just by looking at their feathers.
meanings.sent4: The skilled sexer's ability to discern the sex of animals amazed everyone at the zoo.
meanings.sent5: The young sexer learned to identify the sex of animals through training and practice.

meanings.definition: To determine the sex of animals.
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian will sexer the kittens to ensure they are all healthy.
meanings.sent2: It is important to sexer the puppies early on to plan for their care.
meanings.sent3: The wildlife biologist had to sexer the birds in order to study their population.
meanings.sent4: She had to sexer the rabbits quickly before releasing them back into the wild.
meanings.sent5: The farmer needed to sexer the piglets to separate them into male and female groups.

meanings.definition: A tool used for determining the sex of animals.
meanings.sent1: The sexer is a small device that helps farmers identify the gender of their livestock.
meanings.sent2: Using the sexer, the researcher was able to sort the fish by their sexes efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The new sexer gadget made the task of identifying animal genders much easier.
meanings.sent4: The high-tech sexer was a game-changer for the wildlife conservation team.
meanings.sent5: The old sexer tool was replaced with a more accurate and reliable version.
